diff_hunk:
@@ -100,5 +100,5 @@ if [[ "$BUILD_TEST_LIBTORCH" == "1" ]]; then
   echo "Building libtorch"
   # NB: Install outside of source directory (at the same level as the root
   # pytorch folder) so that it doesn't get cleaned away prior to docker push.
-  WERROR=1 VERBOSE=1 tools/cpp_build/build_all.sh "$PWD/../cpp-build"
+  TORCH_WERROR=1 VERBOSE=1 tools/cpp_build/build_all.sh "$PWD/../cpp-build"
body: I think it would be easier/better to use the same set of warning flags for the whole project, and then add the warnings back. Since this build has always been separate, I could do whatever I wanted, including adding all the warnings I wanted. If we're unifying, we should use the same warnings with the same `WERROR` everywhere. So you should instead just remove the additional warnings that break the CI

body_text: I think it would be easier/better to use the same set of warning flags for the whole project, and then add the warnings back. Since this build has always been separate, I could do whatever I wanted, including adding all the warnings I wanted. If we're unifying, we should use the same warnings with the same WERROR everywhere. So you should instead just remove the additional warnings that break the CI
